title: Cost to Build a 5 Marla / 10 Marla / 1 Kanal House in Multan (Updated Guide)
excerpt: Building a home in Multan involves multiple cost factors such as grey structure, finishing materials, labor, design, and society requirements. This updated guide breaks down the complete cost to build a 5 Marla, 10 Marla, and 1 Kanal house in Multan, helping homeowners plan confidently and avoid unexpected expenses.
content:
Introduction: Understanding House Construction Costs in Multan

Multan is one of Pakistan’s fastest-growing cities, with new housing societies and modern homes being built at a rapid pace. Whether you plan to build a 5 Marla, 10 Marla, or 1 Kanal home, understanding the construction cost in advance is essential for proper budgeting. This guide provides an updated and accurate breakdown of material costs, labor charges, grey structure estimates, and finishing costs in Multan.

1. Factors That Affect House Construction Cost

The cost of building a house in Multan depends on several key elements:
- Grey structure materials
- Finishing materials and quality grade
- Labor costs
- Design and architectural fees
- Housing society bylaws
- Plot location and soil condition

Knowing these factors helps you plan your budget more realistically.

2. Cost to Build a 5 Marla House in Multan (Updated)

A standard 5 Marla house usually ranges between 1,900 to 2,200 square feet of covered area. Below is the cost breakdown:

Grey Structure Cost
The grey structure includes bricks, cement, steel, plumbing, wiring, and labor. In Multan, the updated grey structure cost for a 5 Marla house is approximately:
- PKR 3,200,000 to 3,700,000

Finishing Cost
This includes tiles, windows, doors, kitchen, paint, woodwork, wardrobes, and other interior details. On average:
- PKR 3,000,000 to 4,000,000

Total Estimated Cost (5 Marla)
- PKR 6,200,000 to 7,700,000

The final cost varies depending on material selection and design complexity.

3. Cost to Build a 10 Marla House in Multan (Updated)

A 10 Marla home typically has 3,300 to 3,800 square feet of covered area. Here is the cost analysis:

Grey Structure Cost
- PKR 5,800,000 to 6,800,000

Finishing Cost
- PKR 4,500,000 to 6,500,000

Total Estimated Cost (10 Marla)
- PKR 10,300,000 to 13,300,000

The cost mainly depends on tile quality, wood type, door selection, kitchen accessories, and electrical fittings.

4. Cost to Build a 1 Kanal House in Multan (Updated)

A 1 Kanal house covers approximately 5,000 to 5,800 square feet. These are the updated cost estimates:

Grey Structure Cost
- PKR 10,000,000 to 12,000,000

Finishing Cost
- PKR 10,000,000 to 15,000,000

Total Estimated Cost (1 Kanal)
- PKR 20,000,000 to 27,000,000

The cost fluctuates based on premium finishes such as imported tiles, high-end wardrobes, branded sanitary fittings, and luxury kitchen accessories.

5. Why Construction Costs Differ in Different Areas of Multan

Construction costs vary between societies like DHA Multan, Citi Housing, Buch Villas, and earlier-developed areas. Factors include:
- Society restrictions and design requirements
- Soil condition and foundation needs
- Material availability near the site
- Water and electricity connection charges

Premium societies often require higher-quality finishes and stricter guidelines.

6. How ANU Architects Helps You Save Cost

ANU Architects optimizes your construction budget through:
- Efficient architectural design
- Minimizing material waste
- Smart planning for ventilation and lighting
- Accurate working drawings
- Structural integrity to avoid long-term repairs

With the right design, homeowners save significantly on utilities and construction waste.

Conclusion: Plan Smart, Build Smart

Building a home requires a clear understanding of materials, budgeting, labor, and design. With this updated cost guide for 5 Marla, 10 Marla, and 1 Kanal houses in Multan, you can plan your construction journey confidently. If you want detailed planning, drawings, or complete turnkey construction, ANU Architects is ready to guide you at every step.
